about.name: Ewan Rakotoanosy
about.text1_1: Graduated with a Master's degree in Computer Science from the University of Savoy
about.text1_2: With a year in Erasmus in Ireland 🇮🇪, at Dundalk Institute of Technology (BSc Hons in Computing in Software Development)
about.text2: I've a strong interest in IT and development, I am continually developing my skills by carrying out various projects. But I'm also passionate about video games 🎮 strategy, 4X, RPG, as well as JDR, manga, novels (SF and Heroic Fantasy).
about.text3: Also a great sportsman, I do Enduro mountain biking 🚵 in competition at regional and national level 🇫🇷 as well as skiing in winter 🏂, climbing 🧗, etc...

exp1.title: Cr√©dit Agricole Technologies & Services
exp1.description: Apprenticeship as a developer within the Fraud squad of CA-TS. I worked on the Back-End of the card payment dispute tool made available to all 40 Credit Agricole branches. Back-end realized in JAVA with Spring Boot, with a mySQL database. I was also able to deepen the work I had done on the Fraud squad webapp which allows us to pilot the Card Dispute tool (WebApp with an angular Front, a bff and a back in JAVA Spring)

exp2.title: Credit Agricole Technologies & Services
exp2.description: Internship as a developer within the CA-TS Fraud squad. I was able to create a WebApp for the Fraud squad to facilitate the piloting of the Credit Agricole card payment dispute tool. This WebApp is made in Angular for the Front, in JAVA Spring for the Back and the Back-For-Front and in mySQL for the database.

exp3.title: VTT Pays de Gavot
exp3.description: Development of an application with an Angular Front-end, a Nestjs API and a SQL database to manage a mountain bike competition, with the generation of a scorecard, the entry of the results of the 'Trial' technical event, the generation of the ranking, etc.

exp4.title: Occult
exp4.description: Development of a tool allowing to securely store files on any supported storage platform (ex: SFTP, Google Drive, S3 Bucket). Development in progress with a team of 3 people

exp5.title: Factorio Items Helper
exp5.description: As part of the Knowledge Engineering course in University of SavoY, I created a webApp to help Factorio players find the crafting recipes for the game's items, as well as production ratios.

exp6.title: Rec'Appel
exp6.description: As part of a University project, I created, within a team of 4 people, a tool to analyze customer phone call data for CA-TS. The tool allows you to visualize call routing, wait times, etc.

exp7.title: Save Humanity
exp7.description: As part of the Mobile Development course, I created a Mobile application inspired by the Reign game, with an export of stats to a Next.js BackEnd, and a display of these statistics on an Angular webApp
